intro: Testudinaria, commonly known as the turtlehead plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that resemble the head of a turtle, hence its common name. These plants are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in the United States and Mexico. They typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Testudinaria species often have lance-shaped leaves and produce showy blooms in shades of purple, pink, and white.
